articles.headline: ‘NewsHour’ Appoints First Female Anchor Team
articles.snippet: The appointment of Judy Woodruff and Gwen Ifill as co-anchors of NewsHour is another milestone for women in broadcast journalism.
articles.abstract: The appointment of Judy Woodruff and Gwen Ifill as co-anchors of NewsHour is another milestone for women in broadcast journalism.
articles.lead_paragraph: The PBS “NewsHour,” which was co-anchored for decades by the two men who created it, will soon be co-anchored by two women.

articles.headline: Billionaires’ Battle Over LightSquared Breaks Into the Open
articles.snippet: Philip A. Falcone filed a lawsuit on Tuesday that accused the satellite television mogul Charles W. Ergen of colluding with a hedge fund in a “fraudulent scheme” that prevented his broadband wireless company, LightSquared, from emerging out of ban...
articles.abstract: Philip A. Falcone filed a lawsuit on Tuesday that accused the satellite television mogul Charles W. Ergen of colluding with a hedge fund in a “fraudulent scheme” that prevented his broadband wireless company, LightSquared, from emerging out of bankruptcy.
articles.lead_paragraph: The hedge fund tycoon Philip A. Falcone may be down, just a month after regulators rejected his settlement over federal charges of market manipulation. But on Tuesday, he showed that he’s not out of the game yet.

articles.headline: Worker Bees on a Rooftop, Ignoring Urban Pleasures
articles.snippet: At One Bryant Park in Manhattan, the Durst Organization is cultivating bees as part of an environmental program for the 51-story building.
articles.abstract: At One Bryant Park in Manhattan, the Durst Organization is cultivating bees as part of an environmental program for the 51-story building.
articles.lead_paragraph: On the rooftops above the office canyons of Midtown Manhattan, there is a corporate life for bees where new colonies pollinate green roofs and produce honey for the lucky tenants working below.

articles.headline: Justice Dept. Sues Bank of America Over Mortgage Securities
articles.snippet: The government accused the bank of defrauding investors by vastly understating the risks of the mortgages backing about $850 million worth of mortgage-backed securities.
articles.abstract: The government accused the bank of defrauding investors by vastly understating the risks of the mortgages backing about $850 million worth of mortgage-backed securities.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department sued Bank of America on Tuesday, accusing the bank of defrauding investors by vastly understating the risks of the mortgages backing about $850 million in securities.

articles.headline: The Moto X From Google, iPhone’s Latest Challenger
articles.snippet: Google’s own Android phone offers five features that no phone has offered before, including a touchless mode.
articles.abstract: Google’s own Android phone offers five features that no phone has offered before, including a touchless mode.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s getting harder and harder to invent the iPhone Killer. Even for Apple.

articles.headline: National Push by a Local Immigration Activist: No G.O.P. Retreat
articles.snippet: In a broad populist campaign, a Georgia-based former insurance agent has joined forces with national leaders of groups pressuring Republicans to oppose a path to legal status for millions of immigrants.
articles.abstract: In a broad populist campaign, a Georgia-based former insurance agent has joined forces with national leaders of groups pressuring Republicans to oppose a path to legal status for millions of immigrants.
articles.lead_paragraph: ATLANTA — He says the United States is filling up with immigrants who do not respect the law or the American way of life. He refers to Latino groups as “the tribalists,” saying they seek to impose a divisive ethnic agenda. Of his many adversaries, he says: “The illegal alien lobby never changes. It’s the Wall Street wing of the Republican Party joining forces with the Chamber of Commerce, the far left and the Democrats in an effort to expand cheap labor and increase voting for the Democratic Party.”

articles.headline: Violent and Chaotic, Central African Republic Lurches Toward a Crisis
articles.snippet: Humanitarian groups are warning of a looming disaster in the former French colony, where Seleka rebels have been looting, raping and killing, and coups have outnumbered fair elections.
articles.abstract: Humanitarian groups are warning of a looming disaster in the former French colony, where Seleka rebels have been looting, raping and killing, and coups have outnumbered fair elections.
articles.lead_paragraph: BANGUI, Central African Republic — The two men lay still in the back of the pickup truck, staring up. Over them stood the uniformed rebels, rifles pointing out as the truck sped forward.

articles.headline: Bezos Brings Promise of Innovation to Washington Post
articles.snippet: It would not be surprising to see Jeff Bezos worry little about turning a quick profit at The Post and instead try to shake up the newspaper industry.
articles.abstract: It would not be surprising to see Jeff Bezos worry little about turning a quick profit at The Post and instead try to shake up the newspaper industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: The big news in newspapers — that Jeffrey P. Bezos is buying The Washington Post — was not even 24 hours old when shock and wisecracks about the unexpected $250 million deal began to give way to acceptance and even envy.
articles.byline: By Jenna Wortham and Amy O'Leary

articles.headline: Washington Steps Warily on Housing
articles.snippet: Efforts to change the current system for financing the American dream of owning a home will be difficult, because Americans like inexpensive mortgage loans.
articles.abstract: Efforts to change the current system for financing the American dream of owning a home will be difficult, because Americans like inexpensive mortgage loans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the seven years since the housing market started to fall apart, politicians of both parties have promised repeatedly to build a better system for financing the American dream of owning a home. There is little sign of progress.

articles.headline: Japan Stepping In to Help Clean Up Atomic Plant
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe called for intervention as concern grew over new contamination from the Fukushima Daiichi plant into the Pacific Ocean.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe called for intervention as concern grew over new contamination from the Fukushima Daiichi plant into the Pacific Ocean.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — First, a rat gnawed through exposed wiring, setting off a scramble to end yet another blackout of vital cooling systems at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear plant. Then, hastily built pits for a flood of contaminated water sprang leaks themselves. Now, a new rush of radioactive water has breached a barrier built to stop it, allowing heavily contaminated water to spill daily into the Pacific.

articles.headline: How UrgentRx Crashed the Party at the Cash Register
articles.snippet: A purveyor of over-the-counter medications creates prime display space for his wares, even in the most crowded drugstores.
articles.abstract: A purveyor of over-the-counter medications creates prime display space for his wares, even in the most crowded drugstores.
articles.lead_paragraph: The checkout line in Duane Reade drugstores encompasses some of the most coveted real estate in New York. Within a five-foot radius of the cash register, dozens of the biggest brands in the world vie for attention from hooks, racks and shelves, every inch of which have been allocated according to the product’s place in the retail pecking order.
